title: Diff eq.: No context, with d2y/dx2

content.question: Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@417F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) On the axes provided, sketch a slope field for the given differential equation at the nine points indicated.

frqParts.text: Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@417F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) On the axes provided, sketch a slope field for the given differential equation at the nine points indicated.

(b) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BAE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of x and y. Describe the region in the xy-plane in which all solution curves to the differential equation are concave up.

(c) Let y = f(x) be a particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(0) = 1. Does f have a relative minimum, a relative maximum, or neither at x = 0? Justify your answer.
(d) Find the values of the constants m and b, for which y = mx + b is a solution to the differential equation.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
